content: FRANKFURT/STUTTGART SAP's order pipeline for the second half of the year is "very healthy" and will offset a decline in sales from its packaged software products  which will pose no threat to the company's full-year operating profit target  its finance chief said.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP CFO says pipeline looks very healthy

content: FRANKFURT German business software maker SAP posted quarterly profit at the low end of forecasts  hit by weak sales of its traditional packaged software and a rapid shift by customers to lower-margin cloud software delivered via the Internet.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP's packaged software suffers amid switch to cloud

content: * Still sees 2015 operating profit 5.6-5.9 bln euros   (Adds details  background  shares)

content: FRANKFURT  July 21 German business software maker SAP  reported mixed quarterly results on Tuesday as revenues topped expectations due to a surge in newer  lower-margin cloud software delivered via the Internet  pushing down profit to the very low end of hopes.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP posts Q2 profit at low end of expectations  hit by cloud sales

content: MANNHEIM  Germany German software company SAP's chief executive once again ruled out any move to acquire Salesforce.com  then went further by saying that its richly valued rival is unlikely to be acquired by any other player in the industry.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP chief sees no takers for software rival Salesforce

content: MANNHEIM  Germany  May 20 German software company SAP's chief executive once again ruled out any move to acquire Salesforce.com  then went further by saying that its richly valued rival is unlikely to be acquired by any other player in the industry.
name: SAP SE
title: UPDATE 1-SAP chief sees no takers for software rival Salesforce

content: FRANKFURT/WALLDORF  May 5 SAP Chief Executive Bill McDermott said his company has "zero interest" in acquiring software rival Salesforce.com  which is rumoured to be for sale.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP CEO says has "zero interest" in Salesforce.com deal

content: FRANKFURT  April 21 The weaker euro boosted revenue at German business software maker SAP in the first three months of the year and drove operating profit up 15 percent  although a rise in newer cloud-based software sales squeezed margins.
name: SAP SE
title: UPDATE 3-SAP profit in line with forecasts as sales surge  aided by cheap euro

content: FRANKFURT  April 21 German business software maker SAP on Tuesday reported a 15 percent rise in operating profit helped by a cheap euro  even as rising sales of cloud-based software dampened profit margins relative to its classic licensed software business.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP Q1 operating profit rises 15 pct  aided by cheap euro

content: FRANKFURT  March 31 Klaus Tschira  one of the co-founders of European software giant SAP  has died unexpectedly at the age of 74  his foundation said on Tuesday.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP co-founder Klaus Tschira dies

content: FRANKFURT Cloud software company Salesforce.com Inc aims to overtake SAP in terms of sales on the German company's home market in the coming years  the Europe chief of Salesforce told a German magazine.
name: SAP SE
title: Salesforce aims to surpass SAP on German market: executive tells WiWo

content: FRANKFURT  March 20 SAP  Europe's largest software maker  said on Friday it expected the weak euro boost to operating profit growth by up to 14 percentage points  upping its forecast after the currency weakened further in recent weeks.
name: SAP SE
title: REFILE-UPDATE 2-SAP sees 2015 profit windfall from weak euro

content: FRANKFURT  March 20 Europe's largest software maker SAP expects a 11-14 percentage point boost to its current-year operating profits following further weakening in the euro against the U.S. dollar and other currencies  the company said on Friday.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP sees 11-14 pctg point euro windfall on 2015 profits

content: FRANKFURT German business software maker SAP  said on Thursday it would recommend a 10-percent dividend increase to 1.10 euros  ($1) per share to its shareholders.

title: SAP sees cloud  classic margin improvements to 2020

content: FRANKFURT  Feb 3 SAP has launched the most high-stakes overhaul of its core software line in more than two decades  aiming to convince multinational corporate customers that its software can now run their most critical business applications much faster.

title: SAP launches biggest software product overhaul in two decades

content: GAZA  Jan 21 His company may not rival Google  or German software maker SAP yet  but Gaza-based IT entrepreneur Saady Lozon has plans to change that.
name: SAP SE
title: In Gaza  an IT company has Google-sized aspirations

content: FRANKFURT  Jan 24 Europe's biggest software group SAP could eventually see its software delivered via the cloud deliver higher profit margins than its traditional packaged software  its finance chief told a newspaper.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP sees high cloud profit potential in long term

content: WALLDORF  Germany Europe's largest software group SAP SE has cut key profit forecasts and abandoned a target for higher margins  saying its stepped-up push to deliver products via the cloud would dampen profitability until at least 2018.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP sees lower margins for years to come as cloud transition bites

content: * 2017 operating profit outlook ex-items 6.3 bln-7.0 bln euros

name: SAP SE
title: European shares rise as Chinese growth figures reassure

content: WALLDORF  Germany  Jan 20 Europe's largest software firm SAP lowered its 2017 operating profit outlook on Tuesday  saying its push into cloud-based software delivery would eat into its profit margins.
name: SAP SE
title: SAP cuts 2017 profit outlook as cloud push bites

content: FRANKFURT Germany's SAP on Monday reported an accelerating shift by business customers to internet-delivered cloud software  as it eked out a 1 percent rise in operating profit for the fourth quarter thanks to stable demand for its more classic software.

title: SAP profit holds up in fourth quarter as cloud shift accelerates
